subject: Leadership
title: Thinking in Bets
description: A micro-lesson that makes Thinking in Bets usable.

hook.text: A leader makes a risky call that pays off. Everyone calls her a genius. But was it skill, or luck? Can you tell?

buildup.text: Annie Duke's 'Thinking in Bets': decisions are bets on the future. Good decisions can have bad outcomes, and vice versa.

discovery.text: Judging decisions by outcomes alone is 'resulting.' Better: evaluate the quality of reasoning at the time of the choice.

twist.text: This is counterintuitive: a decision that led to failure might still have been correct given the information available.

climax.text: Leaders improve by separating decision quality from outcome quality and building processes that raise odds over time.

punchline.text: You can't control outcomes. But you can control your reasoning.

quiz.question: What is 'resulting' in decision-making?
options: Judging decisions only by their outcomes
